simplesect.title: Mouse Bindings
simplesect.para: The pekwm Mousebindings go in ~/.pekwm/mouse, and are very simple. They're divided up into two groups: The 'where' and 'event'. Below is an example file:
Below are defined the different fields. The actions themselves can be found in the section.

listitem.para: On menu/cmdDialog/etc pekwm's own window's Titlebar.
On the window's borders. See for more information.
On the screen edges. See for more information.
Anywhere on the window's interiour- it's best to use a keyboard modifier with these.
On the Root window (also called the 'desktop').
On the various menus excluding their titlebars.
On everything else that doesn't have it's own section.
A single click that activates once the button is released
Defines how to act when mouse pointer enters a place defined by the 'where' field.
Defines how to act when mouse pointer leaves a place defined by the 'where' field.
Defines how to act when a dragged window enters a ScreenEdge. Only works with screen edges.

formalpara.title: Additional notes
formalpara.para: Modifiers and mouse buttons can be defined as "Any" which is useful for Enter and Leave events. Any also applies as none. Motion events have a threshold argument. This is the number of pixels you must drag your mouse before they begin to work. Multiple actions can be defined for a single user action. Example:

simplesect.screen: Motion = "1" { Actions = "Move"; Treshold = "3" } ButtonPress = "1" { Actions = "Raise; ActivateClient" }
